name: World Animal Net
membership: Economic and Social Council of the United Nations (Special consultative status), Eurogroup for Animals, International Coalition for Animal Welfare, Species Survival Network, National Council for Animal Protection, DierenCoalitie, Fur Free Alliance, (see: http://worldanimal.net/about/coalitions)
memberOrga: WAN does not have membership, but animal protection organizations can elect to join us as affiliates. We have over 3,000 affiliates worldwide, with over 500 affiliates located across the EU. A list of these organizations is available here: http://worldanimal.net/images/stories/Affiliates/WAN_Affiliates_EU.pdf
goal:
WAN's mission is to improve the status and welfare of animals worldwide by offering information, expertise and new opportunities to connect, collaborate, and campaign for change. Our goals are:
- To develop information, tools and best practice resources for the animal protection community and other animal protection stakeholders; ensuring that these meet major needs, are accurate, easy to access, and well-maintained.
-To enhance, promote and develop collaboration and communication among animal protection organizations in order to avoid duplication and competition and to focus collaborative work on specific animal protection issues and international policy.
-To develop strategic animal protection advocacy and implementation support to improve the status of global animal welfare and the animal protection operating environment.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Development, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Trade
euInitiatives: World Animal Net follows progress on animal welfare in the EU, including: meetings by the Animal Welfare Intergroup, the forthcoming European Platform on Animal Welfare, progress on the European Strategy on Animal Welfare, directives that set standards on farm animal welfare, how competitive distortions between the EU and third countries can be resolved while protecting and promoting animal welfare, and EU activities that affect animal welfare in global development.
